Submodules¶

egenie.backends module¶

class egenie.backends.SimpleBackend[source]¶

Bases: object

eGenie needs a slightly more involved approach to logging in than normal: a password is optional, but only if the user is not an administrator (i.e. superuser or staff).

authenticate(request, username=None, password=None)[source]¶

Authenticate given a username and password. Users are deemed to be authenticated if either a) they are an administrator and have provided the correct password, or b) they are not an administrator.

get_user(user_id)[source]¶

Retrieve a user given a User ID.

egenie.decorators module¶

egenie.decorators.agree_required(f)[source]¶

Some screens require that the user agrees to the study’s conditions. If they have already agreed, they are forwarded on to the URL. Otherwise, they are redirected to an information page where they can choose to continue.

Warning

This is disabled at the moment (user=None rather than user=request.user).

egenie.forms module¶

class egenie.forms.SimpleLoginForm(request=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.forms.forms.Form

A simplified login form. This only differs from the django.contrib.auth AuthenticationForm in that a password is not required for authentication.

base_fields = OrderedDict([('username', <django.forms.fields.CharField object>)])¶
clean()[source]¶
confirm_login_allowed(user)[source]¶

Controls whether the given User may log in. This is a policy setting, independent of end-user authentication. This default behavior is to allow login by active users, and reject login by inactive users. If the given user cannot log in, this method should raise a forms.ValidationError. If the given user may log in, this method should return None.

declared_fields = OrderedDict([('username', <django.forms.fields.CharField object>)])¶
error_messages = {'invalid_login': 'Please enter a correct %(username)s and password. Note that both fields may be case-sensitive.', 'inactive': 'This account is inactive.'}¶

egenie.middleware module¶

class egenie.middleware.CTechMiddleware[source]¶

Bases: object

Some URLs require an anonymous user, especially sdstore and annotation creation. This middleware replaces the logged in user in these instances.

process_request(request)[source]¶

egenie.mixins module¶

class egenie.mixins.AccessMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

‘Abstract’ mixin that gives access mixins the same customizable functionality. This is copied from django-braces to get around us not having a later 1.4.x version installed.

get_login_url()[source]¶

Override this method to customize the login_url.

get_redirect_field_name()[source]¶

Override this method to customize the redirect_field_name.

Provides a list response in JSON form, as opposed to the AjaxableResponseMixin which returns a dictionary.

class egenie.mixins.AjaxableResponseMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

Mixin to add AJAX support to a form. Must be used with an object-based FormView (e.g. CreateView)

class egenie.mixins.BackButtonMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

BackButtonMixin specifies a link (back_url in the context variables) to return to when the back button is pressed. Override the get_back_url function to provide this.

get_back_url()[source]¶
get_context_data(**kwargs)[source]¶
class egenie.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin[source]¶

Bases: egenie.mixins.AccessMixin

View mixin which verifies that the user is authenticated and redirects appropriately (to a Forbidden response if an issue occurs during authentication, otherwise to the login screen)

Note

This should be the left-most mixin of a view, except when combined with CsrfExemptMixin - which in that case should be the left-most mixin.

dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
class egenie.mixins.PlinthMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

PlinthMixin is responsible for detecting whether the user is present at a plinth or not (i.e. looking at an installed on-site tablet). This is based on a plinthid cookie that is set in the on-tablet browser by visiting /setup. This allows also apps to identify which plinth the user is at, for when location is important.

get_context_data(**kwargs)[source]¶
class egenie.mixins.RestrictedMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

RestrictedMixin adds two context variables that are available to apps: ip contains the IP address of the user, while onsite is a boolean which is True if the user is classed as being within the building of the deployment. This is controlled by SITE_IPS in settings.py, with the IP matching if it starts with one of the SITE_IPS values (i.e. 152.78. would match any address starting with 152.78.).

get_context_data(**kwargs)[source]¶

egenie.models module¶

class egenie.models.Participant(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

When a User is created, a Participant model is also created. It only has two properties - the user, and whether they have agreed to participate in the study.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

agreed¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class egenie.models.Plinth(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A Plinth represents a physical podium within the deployment location, which displays the eGenie interface on a tablet.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

deployment¶

The Deployment associated with this Plint.

deployment_id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

location¶

Where this tablet is (e.g. Reception, Office).

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
pi_ip¶

The psychology implementation can show a video feed of the user. This IP address points to the video stream.

printer¶

The unique code for the printer associated with this Plinth.

x¶

The x co-ordinate of the Plinth on the floorplan in pixels.

y¶

The y co-ordinate of the Plinth on the floorplan in pixels.
